text: Manual mode
Operation Manual SIF-400
SIF-400 – Operation Manual – Manual Mode
This manual is a guide to help you manage and control the SIF-400 system manually using the HMI panel on each station.
The main objective is to guide the user through the different processes of each station and, in case of error, to recover the system satisfactorily.
We recommended that you carefully read and follow each of the steps set out in the different sections in order to use the system correctly.
The document consists of two main sections:
1. Common procedures
• The main actions to be performed in all stations when working with the SIF-400
system.
2. SIF-4XX station operation
• Section describing the operation of each SIF-4XX station. Each of the station’s
characteristics is explained in detail.
In order to make it easier to read, we recommend that you follow this document in digital format
For further information on operating the station in integrated mode, refer to the Operation Manual – Integrated Mode

text: 1.1 Switching on and starting up the station
1. Switching on the system
Turn on the lockable main switch located on the first station, on the Energy Data Receiver (EDR) cabinet, by placing it in position I.
Before turning on the main switch, check that the switch at each station is in position 0, otherwise a current spike may occur which will trip the facility’s circuit breaker switch
Turn on each station using the 0/I switch on the front panel. To power-up the station, turn the switch to position I.
Check that the emergency stop push button is not engaged. If it is, follow the steps in Resetting the station
Check that the manual valve of the filtering unit is in SUPPLY mode and that the station is pressured.
1.12 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
2. System shutdown
Proceed as indicated above, following the steps in reverse order:
1. Put the manual valve of the filtering unit in EXHAUST mode and check that the
station is not pressured. 2. Turn off each station using the 0/I switch on the front panel. To power-down the
station, turn the switch to position 0. 3. Turn off the lockable main switch located on the first station, on the Energy Data
Receiver (EDR) cabinet, by placing it in position 0.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.13
1.2 Emergency stop
In the event of an unexpected situation, the user must press the Emergency Stop button and the system will immediately stop safely.
For information, to tell the user about the current situation, the HMI panel will display the message “Emergency status” as shown in the image below.
To make the station operational after an emergency stop, follow the steps in Resetting the station
1.14 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
1.3 Resetting the station
If the station has an error or no starting conditions, a "Reset Cycle" must be carried out for it to run correctly.
The steps to be followed are:
1. Press the emergency stop push button
The HMI screen will display a message in red indicating “Emergency status"
2. Release the emergency stop push button
The Emergency Stop push button will start flashing and the HMI will display a message in green indicating “X2X Bus Module status OK”

1.16 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
1.4 Starting and stopping production
On the main panel of each HMI there is a common button panel that allows the management of the production of each station.
This control unit consists of three buttons and an alarm light.
The mode of operation is described below:
START & STOP buttons
If the START button is active, it will show a green light in the title indicating that the station is in operation. To stop production, press the STOP button.
If the STOP button is active, it will show a red light in the title indicating that the station is stopped. To resume production, press the START button.

text: RESET button
When the station goes into failure mode, the alarm light comes on and a status message is displayed in the lower alert table.
To exit this state there are different modes, the steps to be taken will be indicated in the message in the alert table. The most common action is to press the RESET button to recover the station.
If the RESET button is active, a flashing blue light will be displayed in the title. Press the button to exit this state and recover the station.
Unless the RESET button is active with the title flashing blue, pressing the button will have no effect
If the station goes into error mode during production, the operator should go to the HMI panel and, if indicated there, press the reset button to continue production.

text: 1.5 Remote control of the HMI panel
The HMI panel integrated into each station has dual functions: to operate the station and to display different variables and messages related to the status of the station.

The user can interact with the station by operating it directly, pressing the buttons on the HMI panel. The SIF-400 system also offers the option of connecting to the HMI panel remotely through a mobile device, using the integrated web server.
To do this, we recommended that you follow this procedure:
1. Connect to the SIF-400 Wi-Fi network
Go to the list of Wi-Fi networks on your mobile device, select the WLAN_SIF400 network and enter the password "1234567890".
If your mobile device has a built-in QR code reader, the QR code below allows you to connect to the network by simply scanning it:
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.19
2. Disable access to other wireless networks
In order for the HMI panel web server to be accessed correctly, the mobile device from which the connection is to be established must not have access to the internet.
Therefore, the mobile device must have mobile data deactivated or, failing that, airplane mode activated.
It is important to carry out this step, otherwise the mobile device will not be able to establish the connection with the HMI
3. Connect to the HMI panel of the desired station
Open any browser and enter the following URL: 130.130.130.XXX:8080, where XXX is the address for each station. The table below specifies the IP address of each station:
Station IP address
If the mobile device has an integrated QR code reader, the following QR codes allow you to connect directly to the various stations, without having to enter the URL manually:

1.22 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
1.6 Manual mode & integrated mode
The SIF-400 system has two operating modes:
• Manual mode: the stations are operated individually outside the SIFMES-400
software. • Integrated mode: the stations receive orders from the SIFMES-400 software and
operate together.
To configure the stations in one mode or another, at the bottom of each HMI there are two icons with the SIF400 logo.
The mode of operation is:
• Manual mode: to operate in this mode, press the SIF400 logo image located at the
bottom left of the screen until the same icon appears on the opposite side.
• Integrated mode: to operate in this mode, press the SIF400 logo image at the
bottom left of the screen until a computer icon appears on the opposite side.
Alternatively, you can change modes using the SIFMES-400 software by accessing "System Status" from the "Movement" menu.
If the integrated mode is active, no manual action is possible
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.23
1.7 Quality management
The SIF-400 system has five stations which can assess the production quality:
• SIF-401: a fibre optic sensor checks whether the container picked up by the
electrical axis matches the one ordered by the customer, i.e. whether it is round or square.
If an error occurs in manual mode, the HMI panel will display a pop-up information window indicating that the container collected does not correspond to the one ordered by the customer
• SIF-402: a height measurement system checks that the quantity of pellets deposited
in the container matches the order placed by the customer.
• SIF-403: an ultrasound sensor checks that the amount of liquid, water or oil, poured
into the container matches the order placed by the customer. • SIF-405: a vision camera checks that the lid that has been placed on the container
is correctly inserted using a shape algorithm.
• SIF-407: a vision camera checks that the QR label is correctly positioned and then
performs a reading to verify that its contents are legible.
Quality management in MANUAL MODE for these stations is as follows:
• Good quality: the product will leave position 2 and be sent to the next station as
indicated by the red arrow in the image below.

Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.25
1.8 Planned stops
The HMI panel has a screen that allows the SIFMES-400 software to be informed that a planned stop is being carried out.
Planned stops have an impact on the OEE, allowing the productivity of the station to be measured.
A planned stop can be performed for three reasons:
1. “Raw material changeover”: change of raw material (MANUAL / INTEGRATED).
2. “Tool changeover”: change of tool (MANUAL / INTEGRATED).
3. “Preventive maintenance for component repair”: repair of a component for
maintenance (INTEGRATED).
The PLAY button is only active when the station is in standby mode and displaying the message “Station is ready to run” on the main HMI panel
To initiate a planned stop the operator must press the PLAY button and the counter will start indicating the time elapsed.

text: If the planned stop is in progress, the station will go into alarm mode and a message will be shown on the main display indicating the task being carried out.
To stop the task in progress, the operator must press the STOP button.
Once the planned task has been completed, the operator must press the “RESET" button on the main display of the HMI panel to return to normal operation as indicated in the message.
The effect of planned stops is reflected in production and can be analysed in depth using the integrated mode
For further information on how to manage planned stops in integrated mode, see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.27
1.9 Maintenance of components
The maintenance of the SIF-400 system is managed by the SIFMES-400 software, which determines the useful life of each station component.
The components monitored are:
• Component #1: forward conveyor motor in double line stations, “Transfer engine
- double line forward”. • Component #2: backward conveyor motor in double line stations, “Transfer engine
- double line backwards”.
• Component #3: conveyor motor in single line stations, “Transfer engine - single
line forward”.
• Component #4: pneumatic cylinder that holds the pallet in the operating position
at the production stations, "A Pneumatic cylinder - pallet stopper".
• Component #5: rotary table electrical actuator that picks up and ejects the pallet,
"Table electrical actuator - entry-exit manipulation”.
The following table shows which components each station monitors.

text: Regardless of whether the station is in manual or integrated mode, maintenance management will depend on whether the module is active in the SIFMES-400 software.
If the maintenance module is active, this means that the components could break in the middle of a production run and prevent the cycle from being completed.
If this happens, the station will enter an error mode and display a message indicating which component or components have broken and need to be repaired.
In order to continue with the production it will be necessary to repair this component from the SIFMES-400 software.
For further information on how the maintenance module in the SIFMES-400 software works, see SIFMES-400 Software Manual
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.29
2 SIF-401: Pallet and container feeding
station
1.30 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
2.1 Station function
The function of this station is to feed containers and pallets into the system.
The containers can be of two types: cylindrical or quadrangular. These are stored in gravity feeders which, being modular, can be easily dismantled and interchanged depending on the production loads.

The containers are placed on the pallet by means of electrical and pneumatic actuators and a gravity positioner. All pallets include an RFID label that allows them to be identified and traced throughout the system.
2.2 Station operation
This mode consists of manually feeding the system with pallets and containers.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-401 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode

text: To operate in manual mode, follow the recommended procedure below.
Configuring the station in manual mode
Configure the station to work in manual mode from the main screen of the HMI panel.
For further information on how to set up the station in manual mode, refer to Manual mode & integrated mode
Checking the availability of raw materials
• Containers
Go to the configuration screen "Station Configuration” and verify that the station correctly detects the type of loader in each position, as well as the presence of containers.
Below is an illustration of the different messages that can be displayed:
1. “Canister presence": the loader is detected correctly.
2. “Round boxes loader": round container loader.
1.32 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
3. “Square boxes loader": square container loader.
4. “No canister loader”: there is no loader detected.
5. “No canister units": no containers are detected in the loader.
If the configuration screen shows messages 4 or 5, the loader must be correctly positioned and filled with the appropriate containers.
• Pallets
Visually check that the pallet loader has enough pallets, if not, fill the pallet loaders and place them in the designated location within the station.
Planned stops due to changing raw materials or tools affect the OEE. To record them, follow the instructions in Planned stops
Select product
To launch a product, go to the main screen of the HMI panel and select the action to be carried out:
1. “Round Canister”: launch the production of a round container with pallet.
2. “Square Canister”: launch the production of a square container with pallet.
3. “Pallet w/o Canister”: launch the production of an empty pallet, necessary to
make a customised product.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.33
Launching production
Go to the main screen of the HMI panel and verify that the following message appears in green in the message area: “Station is ready to run”.
Press the START button on the HMI panel, the system will start working.
For further information on controlling production from the control button unit, see Starting and stopping production
Alarms during the cycle
If there is a problem during production, the station will display an alarm in the message table on the main display of the HMI panel. The alarms shown can be of two types:
Alarms that allow production to continue (yellow message):
1. "Missing feeder 1..5”: the loader indicated is not detected at the station. To

continue, place the loader in position and verify that it has been detected on the "Station Configuration" screen of the HMI panel. To finish, press the RESET button on the main screen of the HMI panel.
1.34 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode

3. "Please refill pallets”: there are not enough pallets to carry out the production. To

2. Emergency stops: these are non-production alarms that prevent the system from
operating correctly. For example, pressing the Emergency Stop button.
To recover the station from an emergency stop, refer to Reset the station
2.3 Power consumption

The SIF-400 system is capable of independently measuring the energy consumption of the stations in operation. The power consumption is measured individually for each station and the air consumption is measured for the entire system.
The EDR (Energy Data Receiver) cabinet that collects all this information is located in the SIF-401 station for a complete 12-station SIF-400 system.
The location of the EDR cabinet will depend on the configuration of the SIF-400 system, and the station containing it will be considered to be the first station in the system

The electrical consumption data can be visualised through the HMI panel of each station. The SIF-401 station (or in its absence the first station in the system) is the only one that also shows the air consumption of the complete system.
To display the data, access the following screen:
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.37
By pressing the red PLAY button, you can make a partial measurement of the energy or air consumption in a given interval, allowing the consumption to be measured from that moment.
The air consumption of the SIF-400 system will only be shown on the HMI display of the station containing the EDR cabinet
2.4 Screen messages
The system displays different types of message at the bottom of the main display of the HMI panel depending on the status of the station.
The following shows the different types of messages for the SIF-401 station in both manual and integrated mode:
Information Messages
Station is ready to run Station is ready to start cycle

Maintenance Stop, repairing component#1..5

Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.41
3.1 Station function
At this station, the containers are filled with solid raw material (pellets or granules).
The raw material can be of three different colours (red, blue and yellow) and can be supplied independently or mixed, in different doses.
Once the containers are filled, the amount of material introduced into the container is checked.
3.2 Station operation
This mode consists of manually feeding the containers (round or square) with solid pellets (blue, yellow and red) in different quantities.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-402 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode

3.3 Power consumption

The SIF-400 system is capable of independently measuring the energy consumption of the stations in operation. The power consumption is measured individually for each station and the air consumption is measured for the entire system.
To display the power consumption data of the SIF-402 station, access the following screen:
By pressing the red PLAY button, you can make a partial measurement of the energy or air consumption in a given interval, allowing the consumption to be measured from that moment.
The air consumption of the SIF-400 system will only be shown on the HMI display of the station containing the EDR cabinet

Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.55
4.1 Station function
At this station, the containers are filled with liquid raw material.
Two liquids of different densities can be supplied independently or mixed, with subsequent verification of the filling height.
The station has an area to regulate the flow of the resulting mixture.
4.2 Station operation
This mode consists of manually feeding the containers (round or square) with liquid (water and oil) in different quantities.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-403 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode

Configuring the station in manual mode
Configure the station to work in manual mode from the main screen of the HMI panel.
For further information on how to set up the station in manual mode, refer to Manual mode & integrated mode
Checking the availability of raw materials
• Liquid level
The station has three tanks, one for water, one for oil and one auxiliary tank. For this to work properly, it is essential that the water and oil tanks have enough liquid.
To refill them, the user must connect a bottle of oil to the PB1 + pump (red tube) and a bottle of water to the PB2 + pump (blue tube).
Then, from the main screen of the HMI panel, press the corresponding button:
1. “Fill with water": allows you to fill the water tank from the bottle connected to the
PB2+ pump. The motor pump will start filling the water tank until it is stopped by pressing the button again or until the tank is completely full.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.57
2. “Fill with oil”: allows you to fill the oil tank from the bottle connected to the PB1+
pump. The motor pump will start filling the oil tank until it is stopped by pressing the button again or until the tank is completely full.
On the other hand, if you want to empty the water or auxiliary tanks, press the corresponding button from the main screen of the HMI panel:
3. “Empty water”: allows the water tank to be emptied. To carry out this action, it is
important to follow the instructions below: • Place a dry cloth under the tube to be disconnected to prevent water drops from
falling onto the station when the tube is removed. • Carefully disconnect the tube indicated in the image and connect the tube
through which the water to be extracted from the tank will be directed.
• When the action has finished, reconnect the tube which was previously
disconnected.
4. “Empty auxiliary": empties the auxiliary tank. To carry out this action, it is
important to follow the instructions below:
1.58 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
• Place a fitting on the outlet tap shown in the following image and then open the
liquid flow to empty the tank.
• Once the action has finished, close the tap and remove the fitting.

Finally, if you want to empty the oil tank, you must do so from the tap located on the left side of the station (seen from the front). To empty, just open the tap and it will be emptied by gravity without the need to use the HMI panel.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.59

2. Select liquid(s): Select the desired level of liquid(s).

is correct.

customised product
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.67
5.1 Station function

This station supplies the system with containers of customised material. To do this, the station has feeders adapted to the two types of containers available. The customised product must be previously introduced into the containers by the user.

The containers can contain any externally produced object (through 3D printing, turning, milling, etc.) that fits the available space, taking into account that the container can be covered later in the process.
5.2 Station operation
This mode consists of manually feeding the container system (round or square) with customised product.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-404 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.

6 SIF-405 – Capping station
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.77
6.1 Station function
At this station, the appropriate lid is put on according to the type of container that arrives.

The lids are stored in two interchangeable feeders for round and square lids. A pneumatic part-type detection system recognises which type of lid is in each feeder. The number of lids in each feeder is known in real time, so if any of the feeders are empty this will be detected.
An artificial vision camera verifies that the lid has been placed in the correct position.
6.2 Station operation
This mode consists of manually placing lids (round and square) on the containers.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-405 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode

• Lids

text: 3. “No lids feeder": no lid feeder detected.
4. “Items No.": number of lids in the loader.
If the configuration screen shows message 3 or the feeder does not have enough lids, place a lid feeder in the position indicated and insert lids into it. To do so, follow the steps below:
1. Push the “Refilling” button of the feeder to be changed or refilled.
2. Wait for the corresponding electrical actuator to automatically lower and the
actuator (B) releases the space above the loader. When the process is finished, a pop-up window will appear indicating that the feeder can now be changed or refilled.
It is important that during the process nothing and nobody obstructs the work area so that the station can finish the action safely
1.80 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
3. Carry out the required action and then press the blue CHECK button to finish. The
station will detect the inserted feeder and count the lids inside, leaving the station ready to work.
4. Finally, check in the "Station Configuration” screen on the HMI panel that the
new feeder information is correct.
For safety reasons, it is recommended that only one person carries out the steps outlined above
Planned stops due to changing raw materials or tools affect the OEE. To record them, follow the instructions in Planned stops
Select product
To launch a product, go to the main screen of the HMI panel and select the action to be carried out:
1. "Round Lid": launches production of a container with a round lid.
2. “Square Lid": launches production of a container with a square lid.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.81
3. “Lid type”: indicates the type of lid selected, "00" when no action is selected, "01"
when round lid is selected and "02" when square lid is selected.
Launching production
Go to the main screen of the HMI panel and verify that the following message appears in green in the message area: “Station is ready to run”.
Place an empty pallet in position 1 on the conveyor belt as shown in the image below.
Press the START button on the HMI panel, the system will start working.
1.82 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
For further information on controlling production from the control button unit, see Starting and stopping production
Alarms during the cycle
If there is a problem during production, the station will display an alarm in the message table on the main display of the HMI panel. The alarms shown can be of two types:
Alarms that allow production to continue (yellow message):
1. "Missing feeder 1..2”: the feeder indicated is not detected at the station. To
continue, press the RESET button and wait for a pop-up window to appear indicating that the feeder can now be changed or refilled. Press the blue CHECK button to finish.
2. "Please install a round / square feeder”: no feeder is installed with the type of

lids required for production. To continue, press the RESET button and wait for a pop-up window to appear indicating that the feeder can now be changed or refilled. Press the blue CHECK button to finish.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.83

indicated feeder to carry out the production. To continue, press the RESET button and wait for a pop-up window to appear indicating that the feeder can now be changed or refilled. Press the blue CHECK button to finish.
The process of filling lids or changing the feeder is the same as described in point 2 “Checking the availability of raw materials", except that the process now begins after pressing RESET
Alarms that do not allow production to continue (red message):

Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.89
7.1 Station function
This station acts as a warehouse for finished or semi-finished products. It can store 50 containers and their corresponding pallets.
The warehouse allows the containers to be introduced, extracted and moved internally according to the needs of the process.

This mode consists of manually storing, retrieving and moving the finished or semi-finished product in the warehouse.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-406 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.

dispatch station
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.103
8.1 Station function
This station has a dual function.

First, it prints QR labels that are attached to the containers. An artificial vision system inspects the code to ensure that it is correctly linked to the RFID of the corresponding pallet and guarantees the correct placement of the label.
In addition, the station optionally sends out correctly finished containers for shipping orders of unit products.
8.2 Station operation
This mode consists of manually printing a label and placing it on a container or dispatching the final product.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-407 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.

• QR label printer

• Blue pallet bin
Check the status of the blue pallet bin. To do this, follow the steps described below:
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.105
1. Go to the main screen of the HMI panel and check the number of pallets deposited
in the blue bin indicated under the field label “Empty Blue Bin”:
• Green: pallet bin empty or almost empty (values 0 and 1).
• Yellow: pallet bin almost full (value 2).
• Red: pallet bin full. If not emptied, production cannot continue (value 3).
2. If necessary, reset the pallet bin counter by pressing the red button.
3. A pop-up window will then appear indicating that the pallet bin has been emptied.
4. To finish, remove the pallets from the blue bin and press the blue button in the pop-
up window.
Select product
To launch a product, go to the main screen of the HMI panel and select the action to be carried out:
1. “Print Label”: launches the production of a container with a QR label.

station’s ramp.

9.1 Station function
This station serves as a link between the production stations and the logistics stations.
The containers arrive at the transfer system and are picked up by a collaborative robot and placed in a pack (basket) in one of the station’s three packaging compartments.
The station is colour-coded to indicate the different stages of preparation of each pack.
9.2 Station operation

This mode consists of manually collecting containers from the belt and placing them in a pack in one of the three packaging compartments of the station (Input) or removing a pack from the packaging area by means of a UR robot (Output).
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-408 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode
1.114 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
To operate in manual mode, follow the recommended procedure below.
Configuring the station in manual mode
Configure the station to work in manual mode from the main screen of the HMI panel.
For further information on how to set up the station in manual mode, refer to Manual mode & integrated mode
Starting up the UR Robot

For the SIF-408 station to be fully operational, you must start up the UR Robot. If the UR Robot is disabled, the following message will be displayed on the main screen of the HMI panel "Please enable robot and press reset”.
To enable the UR Robot, follow the steps described below:
1. Press the power button on the console.
2. Press the PLAY button and select "Go to Initialization Screen". Then, on the
“Initialize Robot” screen, press ON to enable the UR Robot.

text: Checking the availability of raw materials
• Upper pack loader
Check the filling status of the station's pack loader. To do this, follow the steps described below:
1. Go to the main screen of the HMI panel and check the number of packs indicated
under the field label "Packs No.”:
• Green: pack loader full or almost full (values 5, 4 and 3).
• Yellow: pack loader almost empty (values 2 and 1).
• Red: pack loader is empty. If not filled, production cannot continue (value 0).
2. Verify that this quantity matches the number of packs available in the station's top
loader.
3. If the number of packs does not match or you want to completely fill the loader,
press the red button.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.121

heading_chain: 4. A pop-up window will then appear indicating that the pack container has been filled.
heading_path: 4. A pop-up window will then appear indicating that the pack container has been filled.
image_metadata_name: SIF408_4. A pop-up window will then appear indicating that the pack container has been filled._image_1

text: 4. A pop-up window will then appear indicating that the pack container has been filled.
5. To finish, fill the loader completely by inserting 5 packs into it and press the blue
button on the pop-up window. • Blue pallet bin
Check the filling status of the pallet bin. To do this, follow the steps described below:
1. Go to the main screen of the HMI panel and check the number of pallets deposited
in the blue bin indicated under the field label “Pallet No.”:
• Green: pallet bin empty or almost empty (values 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4).
• Yellow: pallet bin almost full (values 5, 6 and 7).
• Red: pallet bin full. If not emptied, production cannot continue (value 8).
1.122 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
2. Check that this quantity is equal to the number of pallets deposited in the pallet
bin. 3. If the quantity does not match, make sure that there are NO more pallets inside the
container than the number indicated under the label "Pallet No.". Otherwise, the UR Robot could fail when a new pallet is placed inside it.
The number of pallets in the bin cannot be reset manually. You have to wait for the UR robot to complete a cycle or turn off the station

P1 P2
P3 P4
The cycle starts with the UR Robot taking a pack out of the pack store and placing it in the selected packaging area. Above each packing area there is an indicator that shows the status of the dock:
• Green light: The loading dock is ready to receive packs.
• Orange light: The loading dock is occupied.
• Red light: The pack located inside the loading dock is completed or finalised.
In the process of placing the pack, the UR Robot puts the pack in front of a BCR code reader. The reading of this code can be seen on the main display of the HMI panel.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.125
If the reading is incorrect, an error message will be displayed on the screen and the code must be entered manually.
Press the numbers and a keyboard will appear. After entering the BCR code on the side of the pack itself, press the blue button to apply the changes.
The process ends when the container has been inserted into the pack.
Dispatch a pack
Go to the main screen of the HMI panel and click on “Output” to open the screen “Output Box Movement Mode”.

If there is a problem during production, the station will display an alarm in the message table on the main display of the HMI panel. The alarms shown can be of two types:

following the steps described above in “checking availability of raw materials”. To finish, press the RESET button on the main screen of the HMI panel.

9.3 Power consumption

The SIF-400 system is capable of independently measuring the energy consumption of the stations in operation. The power consumption is measured individually for each station and the air consumption is measured for the entire system.
To display the power consumption data of the SIF-408 station, access the following screen:
1.130 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
By pressing the red PLAY button, you can make a partial measurement of the energy or air consumption in a given interval, allowing the consumption to be measured from that moment.
The air consumption of the SIF-400 system will only be shown on the HMI display of the station containing the EDR cabinet

11 SIF-410 – Pack palletising station
(ADEPT robot)
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.143
11.1 Station function
This station is in charge of palletising packs, prepared in previous stages of the process.

Allows you to create single- or double-layer pallet packs. To do this, a SCARA robot feeds the pallet system on which it will place the packs. Later, the same robot packages them with transparent film.
The station is enclosed and has safety barriers.
11.2 Station operation
This mode consists of palletising and packaging packs manually.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-410 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode
To operate in manual mode, follow the recommended procedure below.

text: Configuring the station in manual mode
Configure the station to work in manual mode from the main screen of the HMI panel.
For further information on how to set up the station in manual mode, refer to Manual mode & integrated mode
Starting up the SCARA Robot
For the SIF-410 station to be fully operational, you must start up the SCARA Robot. To enable it, follow the steps described below.
1. Check that the key switch on the SCARA Robot control panel, “MODE
SELECTION” is in computer mode.
2. Wait until the “ROBOT POWER” button on the control panel starts flashing.
3. Verify that the station’s security door is closed.
If the safety door is opened during an operating cycle, both the robot and the electrical and pneumatic actuators stop
4. Make sure that nothing and no one cuts the beam of light of the safety barriers
located at the rear of the station.
If the beam of light of the safety barriers at the rear of the station is cut during station operation, both the robot and the electric and pneumatic actuators stop
5. Press the “ROBOT POWER” button, checking that it stops blinking thus indicating
that the SCARA Robot is ready to work.

text: Checking the availability of raw materials
• White pallets
Visually check the filling level of the station's white pallet loader. If you need to fill it, follow the steps described below:
1. Open the safety door to access the white pallet loader inside the station.
2. Fill the loader and close the safety door.
3. Enable the SCARA Robot by following the steps described in “Starting up the
SCARA Robot”.
• Film
Visually verify that there is enough film to wrap the pack. If you need to change the roll, follow the steps described below:
1. Go to the main screen of the HMI panel and click on the “Plastic Film” button.
2. The electrical axis will start to rise automatically, making it easier to remove the
empty film roll. 3. Remove the old roll and put in the new one.
4. When you have completed the action, press the blue button on the pop-up window
displayed on the HMI panel. The station will begin to reset automatically.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.147
5. Enable the SCARA Robot by following the steps described in “Starting up the
SCARA Robot”.
The change of the plastic film can only be done with the station in standby mode
Select product
To launch a product, go to the main screen of the HMI panel and select the action to be carried out:
1. "1 Level": launches production for palletising and wrapping a single-height pack.
2. "2 Level": launches production for palletizing and wrapping a double-height pack.
3. "Level No.": indicates the type of production launched, "0" when no production
type has been selected, "1" for single-height palletising and "2" for double-height palletising.
1.148 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode

heading_chain: If you want to make a double-height pallet pack, carry out the process twice and insert one pack each time
heading_path: If you want to make a double-height pallet pack, carry out the process twice and insert one pack each time

text: Launching production
Go to the main screen of the HMI panel and verify that the following message appears in green in the message area: “Station is ready to run”.
Place a pack in position 6 on the conveyor belt as shown in the image below.
Regardless of the action selected, packs should be inserted one at a time, never stacked
If you want to make a double-height pallet pack, carry out the process twice and insert one pack each time
Press the START button on the HMI panel, the system will start working.
For further information on controlling production from the control button unit, see Starting and stopping production
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.149
The cycle begins with the reading of the BCR code contained on the pack for identification purposes. You can verify that the code has been read correctly on the main display of the HMI panel.
The process ends when the palletised and wrapped pack leaves the station’s safety area on the conveyor belt.
Alarms during the cycle
If there is a problem during production, the station will display an alarm in the message table on the main display of the HMI panel. The alarms shown can be of two types:
Alarms that allow production to continue (yellow message):
1. "Robot is disabled, please enable to continue”: the SCARA Robot has been
stopped for safety reasons and is disabled.
• On the main screen, a pop-up window will be displayed indicating that the
SCARA Robot is disabled.
• To continue, re-enable it following the steps described previously in “Starting
up the SCARA Robot”. To finish, press the RESET button on the main screen of the HMI panel.

11.3 Power consumption

The SIF-400 system is capable of independently measuring the energy consumption of the stations in operation. The power consumption is measured individually for each station and the air consumption is measured for the entire system.
To display the power consumption data of the SIF-410 station, access the following screen:
By pressing the red PLAY button, you can make a partial measurement of the energy or air consumption in a given interval, allowing the consumption to be measured from that moment.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.153
The air consumption of the SIF-400 system will only be shown on the HMI display of the station containing the EDR cabinet

13 SIF-411 – Pack pallet labelling station
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.173
13.1 Station function
This station dispenses NFC labels and prints barcodes on them in continuous motion. These labels are placed on the plastic wrapping of the packs.
Before the pack leaves the station, an NFC reader links its code to the system's database to store all order-related information in one place (quantities, date of manufacture, contents, etc.).
13.2 Station operation
This mode consists of manually identifying the products by means of an NFC label placed on the plastic packaging of the pack and then printing a barcode on it.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-411 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode
1.174 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode

• NFC label printer
Check the status of the NFC label printer. To do this, follow the steps below.
1. Make sure the NFC label dispenser is switched on. To do this, turn the dispenser
on manually using the selector located on the front (0, I, II) by turning it to position I.
2. Make sure the dispenser has NFC labels, if not, replace the label roll as shown in

text: It is very important that the NFC label is positioned correctly for handling. For further information please refer to the user manual of the label dispenser
• Barcode Marker
Check the status of the barcode marker. To do this, follow the steps below.
1. Verify that the marker has enough ink by checking the ink level visually as shown
in the image. The exact level can also be checked from the configuration software.
1.176 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
A green light indicates that the ink level is correct, a yellow light that the level is below 5% and a red light that there is no ink
2. If the marker starts printing poorly, it is recommended that you perform a purge
cycle of the head. To do this, follow the steps below.
• Wipe the head with a damp cloth.
• Cover the marker head with paper to prevent staining of other items.
• Purge by simultaneously pressing the buttons shown in the image.
• Then repeat the printing process, placing the pallet pack just in front of the
printer and sticking on a new NFC label
If the label has been printed correctly, the SIF-412 station will read it and proceed to store the product in the dock.
Select product
To launch a product, go to the main screen of the HMI panel and select the action to be carried out:
1. “Spain”: indicates that the pack will be sent to Spain.
2. “Japan”: indicates that the pack will be sent to Japan.
3. “USA”: indicates that the pack will be sent to USA.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.177
Depending on the country selected, one of the three barcodes below will be printed on the NFC label:
USA
Spain
Japan

14 SIF-412 – Pack pallet dispatching
station
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.183
14.1 Station function
The function of this station is to send complete pallets of packs to the customer.
The pallet of packs will be dispatched through one of the three defined loading docks. A colour-coded status indicator shows the status of the loading dock.
By placing a mobile device with an NFC scanner near the pallet shipping label, you can obtain information about the delivery of the order.
14.2 Station operation
This mode consists of manually storing finished packs in different loading docks.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-412 station has two different operating modes, manual mode and integrated mode. To operate in integrated mode, you will need to run the SIFMES-400 operation software.
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode
To operate in manual mode, follow the recommended procedure below.
1.184 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode

text: Configuring the station in manual mode
Configure the station to work in manual mode from the main screen of the HMI panel.
For further information on how to set up the station in manual mode, refer to Manual mode & integrated mode
Check the status of the loading docks
Check the status of the station's loading docks. To do this, follow the steps described below:
1. Go to the “Clear All Positions” screen of the HMI panel.
2. Check the quantity of packs stored in each of the loading docks:
• Green: dock is empty (value 0).
• Yellow: dock with goods inside (values 1 and 2).
• Red: dock full. If not emptied, nothing can be stored inside (value 3).
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.185
In addition, each dock has a light at the top indicating its filling status with the same colour code described above
3. Empty the loading docks if necessary by pressing the red “Push here” button on
the HMI panel.
This action releases ALL the positions in the warehouse. To be able to release some specific positions see Remove a finished pack from the dock
1.186 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
Select product
To launch a product, go to the main screen of the HMI panel and select the action to be carried out:
1. "Dock#1": stores the finished pack in position 1 of the loading dock.
2. “Dock#2": stores the finished pack in position 2 of the loading dock.
3. “Dock#3": stores the finished pack in position 3 of the loading dock.
Remove a finished pack from the dock
Go to the “Dispatch a PackPallet” screen of the HMI panel.

15 SIF-413 – Recycling station
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.195
15.1 Station function
This station allows the solid raw material used during the process to be stored and recycled.

The solid raw material is separated and stored by colour thanks to three colour detection sensors and three blowers. In addition, the station has specific locations to place feeders for containers, lids, packs and pallets.
In this way, the material is available to be used again in the system. The entire recycling process is explained in detail in an augmented reality application, VAR-400.
15.2 Station operation
This mode consists of automatically recycling solid raw materials.
Below is the main screen of the HMI panel:
The SIF-413 station has only one operating mode, manual mode.
For further information on how to use integrated mode see Operation Manual - Integrated Mode
1.196 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode

heading_path: Checking the availability of raw materials

text: To operate in manual mode, follow the recommended procedure below.
Checking the availability of raw materials
Verify that the vibrator is correctly configured and has enough solid raw material to operate. To do this, follow the steps described below:
1. Physically check that the vibrator potentiometer, located on the electrical mesh, is
set between 40% and 60%.
2. Check that the vibrator has enough solid raw material to operate. Otherwise, the
HMI panel will display the following pop-up window indicating that this must be filled to continue.
3. To finish, fill the vibrator with solid raw material and press the blue “READY”
button.
Launching production
Go to the main screen of the HMI panel and verify that the following message appears in green in the message area: “Station is ready to run”.
Press the START button on the HMI panel, the system will start working.
Operation manual SIF-400 - Manual Mode 1.197
For further information on controlling production from the control button unit, see Starting and stopping production
15.3 VAR-400 Augmented Reality Application
There is a virtual augmented reality application for smartphones, called VAR-400, which is used to show the user how to run different processes on this station.
The processes carried out by the station are: quick start, recycling, change of loaders and emergency cycle. To operate the application, follow the recommended procedure below:
1. Download the VAR-400 application from Google Play.
2. Open the downloaded application and focus the smart device camera on the HMI
panel display shown below:
1.198 Operation manual SIF-400– Manual Mode
3. The application displays a new screen where the user must enter the password
for the application licence (see image below).
4. Once the user has entered the password, the application displays the menu where
the user can select one of the processes to be explained.
